items.abstract:
<jats:title>Eucharitidae (Hymenoptera), a chalcid wasp family new to the fauna of Poland</jats:title>
        <jats:p><jats:italic>Eucharis adscendens</jats:italic> (Fabricius, 1787) (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Eucharitidae) is reported as occurring in the Mazovian Lowland in central Poland. This represents the first record of the entire family Eucharitidae in Poland, which extends further to the north the geographical range of Eucharitidae in central Europe. <jats:italic>E. adscendens</jats:italic> was observed ovipositing into the flower buds of an umbellifer <jats:italic>Peucedanum oreoselinum</jats:italic> (L.) Moench. The most likely hosts of this chalcid species at this Mazovian location are ants of the genus <jats:italic>Formica</jats:italic> L.</jats:p>
title: Eucharitidae (Hymenoptera), a chalcid wasp family new to the fauna of Poland
